Package uk.ac.kent.graph.display

Class GraphPanel

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.JPanel
uk.ac.kent.graph.display.GraphPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
KeyListener, MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, EventListener, Accessible, MouseInputListener
public class GraphPanel extends JPanel implements MouseInputListener, KeyListener
A panel on which a graph is displayed.

Functions:
- Add a node with double left button click on the background.
- Add an edge with a right button drag (picks closest nodes to start and end of the drag, but does not add self sourcing nodes).
- Drag a node with a left button drag on a node.
- Select a node with a single left button click on a node or a left button drag on the background, add new nodes to the selection by pressing the control key whilst selecting.
- Delete the selection with Del or Backspace

See Also:

    • generateNodeShape

      public Shape generateNodeShape(Node n, String shapeString)
      Gives a new shape object to draw a node. At the moment rectangles and ellipses are supported
      Parameters:
      e - The node.
      shapeString - A string describing the shape of the node, currently "Ellipse" and "Rectangle are supported". Anything that is not one of these defaults to "Ellipse".
      Returns:
      The shape for the node.

    • generateEdgeShape

      public Shape generateEdgeShape(Edge e, Point2D.Float offset)
      Generate a line to draw an edge.
      Parameters:
      e - The edge.
      offset - A parameter for separating parallel edges.
      Returns:
      The shape for the edge.

    • calculateAngle

      public static float calculateAngle(float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2)
      Calculates the angle between the lines x1 to y1 and x2 to y2.
      Parameters:
      x1 - X coordinate of point 1.
      y1 - Y coordinate of point 1.
      x2 - X coordinate of point 2.
      y2 - Y coordinate of point 2.
      Returns:
      The angle of the line.

    • movePoint

      public static Point2D.Float movePoint(Point2D startPoint, float distance, float angle)
      takes the point and returns a new one moved by the distance and angle.
      Parameters:
      startPoint - The point to move.
      distance - The distance to move the point by.
      angle - The angle to move the point.
      Returns:
      The moved point.

    • findNodeNearPoint

      public Node findNodeNearPoint(Point2D.Float p, float padding)
      Finds a node within the passed point, or returns null if the argument point is not over a node. The padding refers to the distance the point can be from the node, and must be greater than 0. If there is more than one node, it finds the last one in the collection, which hopefully should be the one on top of the display.
      Parameters:
      p - The point to test.
      padding - The x and y distance from the node to test.
      Returns:
      The nearest node, or null if there are no nodes within the padding of p.

    • findEdgeNearPoint

      public Edge findEdgeNearPoint(Point2D.Float p, float padding)
      Finds an edge close to the passed point, or returns null if the argument point is not over an edge. The padding refers to the distance the point can be from the edge, and must be greater than 0. If there is more than one edge, it finds the last one in the collection, which hopefully should be the one on top of the display.
      Parameters:
      p - The point to test.
      padding - The x and y distance from the edge to test.
      Returns:
      The nearest edge, or null if there are no nodes within the padding of p.

    • pointLineDistance

      public static float pointLineDistance(Point2D.Float p, Point2D.Float p1, Point2D.Float p2)
      Find the distance from p0 to the line created from p1 p2. If the perpendicular from po to the line is not on the line then the distance is to the end of the line, either p1 or p2
      Parameters:
      p - the point to test.
      p1 - the first point of the line.
      p2 - the second point of the line.
      Returns:
      nearest distance from p to a line segment between p1 and p2.

    • pointIsWithinBounds

      public static boolean pointIsWithinBounds(Point2D.Float p, Point2D.Float p1, Point2D.Float p2)
      Checks to see if the p is within the rectangle given by p1 and p2. Can be used to see if a point is on a line
      Parameters:
      p - The point to test.
      p1 - The left top of the rectangle.
      p2 - The right bottom of the rectangle.
      Returns:
      true if the point is in the rectangle, false otherwise.

    • perpendicularPoint

      public static Point2D.Float perpendicularPoint(Point2D.Float p, Point2D.Float p1, Point2D.Float p2)
      Get the point on the line between p1 and p2 formed by the perpendicular from p.
      Parameters:
      p - the point to test.
      p1 - the first point of the line.
      p2 - the second point of the line.

    • intersectionPointOfTwoLines

      public static Point2D.Float intersectionPointOfTwoLines(Point2D.Float p1, Point2D.Float p2, Point2D.Float p3, Point2D.Float p4)
      Intersection point of two lines, first line given by p1 and p2, second line given by p3 and p4.
      Parameters:
      p1 - First point of line 1.
      p2 - Second point of line 1.
      p3 - First point of line 2.
      p4 - Second point of line 2.
      Returns:
      the intersection point, or null if the lines are parallel.

    • distance

      public static float distance(Point2D.Float p1, Point2D.Float p2)
      Get the distance between two points.
      Parameters:
      p1 - The first point.
      p2 - The second point.
      Returns:
      The distance between p1 and p2.

    • closestNode

      public Node closestNode(Point2D.Float p)
      Finds the closest node in the graph to the point, or returns null if there are no nodes in the graph. If distances are equal, the firs node encountered is returned.
      Parameters:
      p - the point to test.
      Returns:
      the closest node to p.
